lines.text: [after demonstrating how to make a Max hand-puppet from a paper bag]
Make a bunch, and use them to put on twisted puppet shows for the neighborhood kids which will affect them later in life. Use it to communicate ideas and concepts to people of other lands.
Max's terrifying head is a universal symbol of something or other.
[every time a phone rings]
I GOT IT! I GOT IT!
Our highly improbable plan worked, Sam.
Maybe it was towed.
No, I think we nipped that problem in the bud when we shaved the guy at the towing yard. And his dad.
That was the distinctive cry of a loon, mixed with the turbulent roar of the open sea.
The Commissioner, huh.
Cooperate and you will be slapped around without incident.
Sam's bothersome sense of do-gooderism is popping up like a bad rash.
Sounds like a good deed best left to someone who gives a hoot.
We have the safety of the passengers and our pledge to provide patently ridiculous scenarios to consider.
No doubt she is absorbed in high-level closed door doings concerning a matter of the utmost urgency and import.
Either that, our she's taking a little potty break.
That's what I said.
Remember, kids, we're professional cartoon characters. Don't try this at home.
The path of violence can never lead to harmony.
Now you're just being ridiculous.
Holy jumping weasel fritters on a hot cross bun!
Looky there, Max! It's a horde of murderous inner-dwellers.
When there are five or more, the correct term is a "clot."
[Max pulls an enormous wrench out of his pouch]
Max! I didn't know you were a marsupial!
Me neither! Whatever that is...

[on Valentine's Day, Sam and Max's car is stolen. Tracking it down, they find a couple kissing in it]
Aaaaahhhh! It's being used as a make-out van, Sam! We'll have to burn out the interior!
[repeated line]
You crack me up, little buddy.
[Sam and Max have adopted a baby alligator]
[bursting in]
My hamsters are missing.

[sees the alligator]
You can't expect an alligator to adapt to your lifestyle. N0-one can adapt to your lifestyle!

[seeing and hearing Max play bagpipes]
Whoa! That's something I'm gonna have dreams about!
Holy mother of all things hairy and disgusting!
It seems people are disappearing on mass!
Oh my god, Sam! You said 'ON MASS'!
Oh my god, Sam! These people have gills! It's hideous and who would do such a thing and how do we get some?
Gee buddy, in my experience a grade four abrasion like that usually has the recipient bawling like a three legged longshoreman at a cotillion.

I'm just tossing darts in the dark here, but I'd say this whole transdimensional mess is the combined result of you storing toxic oozes in leaky zippy lock bags in a freezer that's as neglected as Quasimodo at a Sadie Hawkins dance.
It was the stern, guiding voice of the Commissioner with just the right kind of hair-raising case we can wrap our overactive adrenal glands around!
Are you talking dirty?
we can breath here, then?
I guess those prissy, paranoid astronauts never had enough spine to try it.
Ooh, I could never say that about an astronaut.
